meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny: It's that time of year again, folks! The leaves are changing, the air is crisp, and the football season is in full swing. What better way to celebrate than with a brand new edition of EA Sports FC, eh?

Now, I know what you're thinking - what's the big deal about yet another sports game update? Well, let me tell you, my friends, this one's got some tricks up its sleeve. Or should I say, some Rush-like excitement in its gameplay!

But before we dive into the good stuff, let's take a look at what the critics have to say. And boy, do they have opinions! The Games Machine gives it 86 out of 100, calling EA Sports FC 25 "an interesting (and more importantly, fun) new edition" with plenty of small tweaks and two big new features: Rush and FC IQ.

COGconnected agrees, giving it a score of 84. They say the tactical layer adds a whole new level of strategy to the game, and that the new PlayStyles and HyperMotion make for an authentic representation of the sport. And let's not forget about those fast-paced, 5-a-side matches in Rush mode!

Gameblog.fr gives it a solid 80, saying it's more like an adjustment than a profound change. But hey, who doesn't love a good update? They also praise the new Rush mode as a big plus.

But Why Tho? chimes in with a score of 75, calling it "a truly upgraded version" that makes the game feel alive and takes another step forward for the franchise.

IGN Spain weighs in with a score of 70, saying it's a more polished experience with deeper career mode options. And GLHF on Sports Illustrated agrees, giving it the same score and praising FC IQ as one of the strongest new features in years.

Gamer.no brings up the rear with a score of 60, calling it "a good game" but not quite worth the upgrade price for those who already own last year's edition. But hey, being the best soccer game out there has to count for something!

So there you have it, folks - EA Sports FC 25: a game that's got people talking (and debating) about its new features and gameplay. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just looking for some fun on the pitch, this one's definitely worth checking out.

And that's Hippo Penny's take on EA Sports FC 25!
